page.title: 19WILDLIFE, MUTHILL AREA.
page.content: Our survey block has many kinds of wildlife. There are{squirrels}red and grey.{Rabbits}and{hares}are plentiful. {Stoats}and{weasels}are common.{ {Hedgehogs}are often killed on the roads at night.Forestry plantations and fewer gamekeepers have led to a rise in the number of{foxes. Roe deer} are seen on most farms and a herd of about 20{red deer }has been observed near {Newra Farm}. {Otter}and{mink}have been seen in the { {Machany,}the mink probably having escaped from a mink farm near Comrie. Birds of prey, such as the{buzzard, {owl,}and{heron}are often seen.{ {Pheasant, partridge, pigeon }and{ {grouse}are very common and provide game shooting.{Wild duck}visit the Machany.{Magpies,oyster catchers, {lapwings}and{curlews}are often seen, and the more common garden birds.
